description: The SNMP trap is generated when a connected client has been
authenticated by its server.

event.Summary: Client $v4 has been authenticated by OpenVPN server $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIOPENVPN-MIB::clientAuthSuccessTrap AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerIndex u 9 AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerName s EXAMPLE AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientIndex u 9 AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientCN s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: The ifIndex of the OpenVPN server.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerIndex

description: The textual name of the OpenVPN server interface.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerName

description: A unique number identifying an authenticated OpenVPN client.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientIndex

description: The common name from the certificate of the OpenVPN client.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientCN

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC
via a window transaction after each trap.
When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP trap is generated when an authenticated client has
disconnected from its server.

event.Summary: Client $v4 has disconnected from OpenVPN server $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIOPENVPN-MIB::clientDisconnectTrap AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerIndex u 9 AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerName s EXAMPLE AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientIndex u 9 AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientCN s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: The ifIndex of the OpenVPN server.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerIndex

description: The textual name of the OpenVPN server interface.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthServerName

description: A unique number identifying an authenticated OpenVPN client.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientIndex

description: The common name from the certificate of the OpenVPN client.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientCN

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap

When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum

description: This is the actual event time of the last trap created by this agent.
When the agent sends traps, it must include the trap aiSystemTrapCreationTime.
When it resends the trap message, the content of this MIB object in the trap
is the time when a trap was last created in the system, not when one was sent out.
The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime

description: The SNMP trap is generated when a connected client has failed to be
authenticated by its server.

event.Summary: Connected client $v1 has failed to be authenticated by OpenVPN server

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AIOPENVPN-MIB::clientAuthFailedTrap AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientAddr.8.9 a 10.168.223.44 AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientPort i 9 AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientConnected s EXAMPLE AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemLastTrapSequenceNum u 9 AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime x 07cc09010F1E00002b011E

description: The external IP address of the OpenVPN client.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientAddr

description: The external port of the OpenVPN client.
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientPort

description: The time the OpenVPN client connected in RFC2579 format:
yyyy-mm-dd,hh:mm::ss.d,soh:om
variables.name: AIOPENVPN-MIB::aiOpenVPNAuthClientConnected

description: This is the sequence number of the last trap sent by this
agent. The sequence number starts at zero following a
hardware reset or power-up. When the sequence number reaches
0xffffffff, it rolls over to 0 on the next trap. If the agent
supports trap sequence numbers, it must include the trap
sequence number when it sends traps and it must notify the CLC

When this varbind appears in a trap, this is the sequence
number of that trap.

The DateAndTime type is a structured OCTET STRING, defined in RFC-2579 SNMPv2-TC
Mib Definition.
variables.name: AISYSTEM-MIB::aiSystemTrapCreationTime
